intro: Sinocarum cruciatum var. cruciatum, commonly known as the crucifix bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested habitats and has a compact, upright growth habit. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem, while its flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the branches. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its striking floral display.
